alert.note: Alert for Grant; Hamilton; Kearny; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 6:24PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hamilton, southwestern Kearny, northwestern Grant and northeastern Stanton Counties through 715 PM CDT/615 PM MDT/... At 623 PM CDT/523 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Big Bow, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Hamilton, southwestern Kearny, northwestern Grant and northeastern Stanton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
